item.title: Morning storms in the forecast
item.description: With onshore or west flow and a some pieces of energy moving in we can expect to see some morning showers and thunderstorms

item.title: Florida Sen. Joe Gruters elected as new Republican National Committee Chairman
item.description: Gruters has been serving as the RNC treasurer.

item.title: Ron Turcotte, the Hall of Fame jockey who rode Secretariat to the 1973 Triple Crown, dies at 84
item.description: Ron Turcotte, the Hall of Fame jockey who rode Secretariat to the 1973 Triple Crown, has died at 84.

item.title: Crews rescue two women in their 80s stuck in hot tub at remote cabin
item.description: Rescue crews in Wolfe County saved two women who were stuck in a hot tub on Wednesday night.

item.title: ‘Most disturbing case’: 2 men accused of raping ‘very young children,’ sheriff says
item.description: Kenneth Leslie Reed Sr., 74, and 31-year-old Justin Allen Stephens were arrested Thursday.

item.title: Farmer’s Markets Saturday Forecast
item.description: Keep an eye to the sky and an umbrella nearby

item.title: Man accused of offering drugs in exchange for his meal in Wendy’s drive-thru
item.description: A man in Colorado is accused of offering drugs in a Wendy’s drive-thru to pay for his meal.

item.title: Beach & Boating Forecast Saturday
item.description: Morning showers are possible. Afternoon thunderstorm, with dangerous lightning, will be more widespread

item.title: Weekend Thunderstorm Chances are Up
item.description: Scattered showers and thunderstorms develop each day, morning and afternoon

item.title: Powell signals Fed may cut rates soon even as inflation risks remain
item.description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on Friday opened the door ever so slightly to lowering a key interest rate in the coming months but gave no hint on the timing of a move.

item.title: First Alert Weather Day
item.description: Storms are expected to fire up early over the Gulf waters, then move inland through the afternoon and evening hours
